textfields.tf: During an ECAS control process a so called "overshooting" is used to reach the reference level in any case.
By pulsing the ECAS solenoid valve an overshooting is prevented.
The ECAS solenoid valve is pulsed, when after overshooting the actual level has to be readjusted to the reference level.

On the left you see an ECAS control process.
Please mark the correct statement:
This statement is wrong. Overshooting is not wanted, for the very reason that the time is lost needed for readjusting in opposite direction.
Overshooting is prevented before reaching the reference level by pulsing the solenoid valve.
This statement is wrong. In this case a reversed control of the solenoid valve would be required.
Right. By pulsing the solenoid valve before reaching the reference level overshooting is prevented.
